type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="manageable" type="xsd:boolean"/> <xsd:element name="aaId" type="GUID" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> name="GuidAndInt"> <xsd:attribute name="id" type="GUID" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="int" type="xsd:int" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="guidAndInt" type="GuidAndInt"/> <xsd:complexType name="GuidAndIntList"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="element" type="GuidAndInt" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="guidAndIntList" type="GuidAndIntList"/> <xsd:complexType name="BaseInfo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the base type for human friendly display information. Besides the guid it infos shouldn't contain any configuration info</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attribute name="id" type="GUID" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="baseInfo" type="BaseInfo"/> <xsd:complexType name="BaseInfoList"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="element" type="BaseInfo" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="RangedInfo"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="firstItem" type="BaseInfo" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="lastItem" type="BaseInfo" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="SubRanges" type="RangedInfoList" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="Items" type="BaseInfoList" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="sortPropertyName" type="xsd:string" use="optional"/> <xsd:attribute name="descendantCount" type="xsd:int" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="itemType" type="xsd:string" use="optional"/> <xsd:attribute name="Id" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is NOT a guid but (if used) should be a contextual representation of the range. In the case of groups it takes the form of the groupid (or empty for root),sortProperty: firstItem Guid ... lastItem Guid e.g. 0000-0000-0000-0000/SmartAgent.Schemas.Noodle?Name:1111-1111-1111-1111...2222-2222-2222-2222 (three periods NOT ellipsis character) In other instances it might be slightly more complex: 0000-0000-0000-0000/Fr-fr/Schemas.Item?Title:1111-1111-1111...1111..2222-2222-2222-2222 any extra info between the Guid/.../Schematype will be stored in the AdditionalInfo field The itemtype,sort propertyName (and range Ids are auto built) so in the above example you would only need to pass in "0000-0000-0000-0000/Fr-fr" to generate the 'Id' Whilst the contents of the range is mutable they (hopefully) will never be void (i.e. even if the firstGuid is 'deleted' the range should still be everything between that deleted items value and the end items value Should we actually be able to come up with a real 'format' that works across all ranges we could do away with the additional attributes here to optimise the payload size</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="infoRange" type="RangedInfo"/> <xsd:complexType name="RangedInfoList"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="element" type="RangedInfo" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ByteArrayPacked"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="name" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="value" type="xsd:base64Binary" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="byteArrayPacked" type="ByteArrayPacked"/> <xsd:complexType name="ByteArrayPackedList"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="element" type="ByteArrayPacked" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="byteArrayPackedList" type="ByteArrayPackedList"/> <xsd:complexType name="OffsetDateTime"> <xsd:attribute name="iso8601" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="offsetDateTime" type="OffsetDateTime"/> </xsd:schema>
